definition: the four seasons/spring, summer, autumn and winter
the Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC/Xia of the Sixteen Kingdoms (407-432)/surname Xia

sentences.english: Summer and winter and springtime and harvest.
sentences.chinese: 春夏秋冬四季，有栽种有收成。

sentences.english: There are spring, summer, autumn and winter, four seasons in a year.
It’s this tilt that gives us our spring, summer, autumn and winter.
sentences.chinese: 正是这种倾斜让我们有了春夏秋冬四季。

sentences.english: New Year is an enthusiastic tourist guide taking us to move towards spring, summer, autumn and winter.
sentences.chinese: 新年是位热情的导游，带着我们走过春夏秋冬。

sentences.english: Rather than give me a pledge of eternal love, to accompany me through each spring, summer, autumn and winter.
sentences.chinese: 与其给我山盟海誓，不如陪我走过每一个春夏秋冬。

sentences.english: The idea is to have a garden that looks brilliant in spring, summer, autumn and winter.
sentences.chinese: 他们的想法是，这座园子在春夏秋冬都要灿烂鲜艳。

sentences.english: There are four seasons in a year: spring, summer, autumn and winter.
Fight a year in spring and summer, autumn and winter, cardiac life no regrets.
sentences.chinese: 拼一年春夏秋冬，搏一生无怨无悔。

sentences.english: Seasons change but remain unchanged is the sizable crowd.
sentences.chinese: 春夏秋冬，四季更迭，不变的是熙来攘往的人群。

sentences.english: Cycle of four seasons, autumn is the harvest season.
sentences.chinese: 春夏秋冬四季轮回，秋季是收获的季节。

sentences.english: The four suits represent the four seasons: Spring, Summer, Fall and Winter.
sentences.chinese: 四种花样代表一年四季，春夏秋冬。

sentences.english: Karry: in a particular season I will think of you, such as spring, summer, autumn and winter.
sentences.chinese: 到了某个特定的季节我就会想起你，比如春夏秋冬。

sentences.english: This drama is classics woof to all alone with the four seasons of Chun Xiaqiu winter.
sentences.chinese: 本剧以春夏秋冬四季为经纬线索。

definition: four seasons, namely: spring 春, summer 夏, autumn 秋 and winter 冬
from dawn to dusk/all the time
ten thousand crags and torrents (idiom); the trials and tribulations of a long journey/a long and difficult road
lit. daily changes of temperature/fig. well-being/sb's comfort, health, prosperity etc
sour, sweet, bitter and spicy hot/fig. the joys and sorrows of life
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
